greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Integer part of square root of n-th triangular number.
formula: a(n) = a(-1-n) = A186221(n) - n for all n in Z. - _Michael Somos_, Aug 19 2018
example: a(10) = 7, the 10th triangular number is 55 and floor(sqrt(55)) = floor(7.4161) = 7.
maple: for n from 1 to 150 do printf("%d,",floor(sqrt(n*(n+1)/2))) od;
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Apr 25 2001
ext: Corrected and extended by Larry Reeves (larryr(AT)acm.org), May 07 2001
